redemption noun
(IMPROVEMENT)
be beyond/past redemption

to be too bad to be improved or saved by anyone: He believed passionately that no human was beyond redemption.

redemption noun
(IN RELIGION)
[ U ] (especially in Christianity) an occasion when someone is saved from evil, suffering, etc.

[ C or U ] the act of exchanging bonds, shares, etc. for money: The bonds will be redeemed at 100% of their principal amount, plus interest to the redemption date.
